descriptionSet.description: On this poster from the Oriental Calender Manufacturing Company, a upper middle classs woman can be seen while powderng her chin. Several other utensils like ornaments and perfume are visible in front of her on her make-up table.

location.name: Delhi / The Priya Paul Collection of Popular Art
Delhi / The Priya Paul Collection of Popular Art

rights.text: Copyrighted. Copyright with the original artists and publishers.

titleSet.title: Portrait of a lady grooming herself in, a sample calender poster of , Calcutta

hra:item.hra:value: text-en: TCM [publisher's signet]

description-en: On this poster from the Oriental Calender Manufacturing Company, a upper middle classs woman can be seen while powderng her chin. Several other utensils like ornaments and perfume are visible in front of her on her make-up table. (gs)
explanatory comments/crosstagging: Images of the home in calendar art also offered women a life of leisure, with ample hours for relaxation. (Abigail McGowan)(gs)
related literature: Braudel, Fernand 1981. "The Structures of Everyday Life". London: Collins. (gs)
related literature: de Certeau, Michel 1984. "The Practices of Everyday Life" . Berkeley: University of California Press. (gs)

related literature: Freitag, Sandria 2007. "South Asian Ways of Seeing; Muslim Ways of Knowing: The Indian Muslim Niche Market in Posters" in Indian Economic and Social History Review, 44:3 (2007):297-331 (gs).
